subject: Sexual Health
title: Types of STI Tests
description: A micro-lesson that makes Types of STI Tests usable.

hook.text: Blood draws, urine samples, and swabs each detect different infections in different ways.

buildup.text: Blood tests detect antibodies the body makes in response to infections like HIV and syphilis.

discovery.text: Urine tests and swabs can detect bacterial DNA directly, identifying chlamydia and gonorrhea quickly.

twist.text: No single test covers all STIs. A full screening requires multiple tests tailored to your risk factors.

climax.text: Knowing which test to request empowers patients to get comprehensive screening, not just partial answers.

punchline.text: One test is not enough. Ask for a full panel.

quiz.question: What do blood tests for STIs typically detect?
